pageTitle: EMCOR to Buy Back Shares, Hike Dividend - December 6, 2013 - Zacks.com
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {62910=At the center of everything we do is a strong commitment to independent research and sharing its profitable discoveries with investors. This dedication to giving investors a trading advantage led to the creation of our proven Zacks Rank stock-rating system. Since 1986 it has nearly tripled the S&P 500 with an average gain of +26% per year. These returns cover a period from 1986-2011 and were examined and attested by Baker Tilly, an independent accounting firm., 14871=by Zacks Equity Research   Published on December 06, 2013 |, 22378=EMCOR Group also raised its quarterly dividend by 33% from 24 cents a share (or 96 cents annually) to 32 cents (or $1.28 annually). The increased dividend will be paid beginning first quarter of 2014. The current dividend yield based on the new payout and the last closing market price (as on Dec 5, 2013) is 3.2%., 21446=This credit arrangement increased EMCOR Group’s liquidity, probably leading to the decision for additional share repurchases and dividend hike. Also, the company’s operating cash flow has been increasing consistently as reported in the company’s third-quarter results (on Oct 24, 2013)., 21123=The news followed a Dec 2 announcement that it will expand credit facility through a $1.1 billion credit agreement with a group of banks. Apart from a $750 million revolving credit, the new credit facility will also have an additional facility for $350 million term loan A. , 62849=Copyright © 2015 Zacks Investment Research}
